title: IMPACT Score for Outcomes in Head Injury
desc: The IMPACT Score for Outcomes in Head Injury predicts 6-month mortality and unfavorable outcomes after moderate to severe traumatic brain injury (TBI).

orgreference.text: Steyerberg EW, Mushkudiani N, Perel P, et al. Predicting outcome after traumatic brain injury: development and international validation of prognostic scores based on admission characteristics. PLoS Med. 2008;5(8):e165.

other_refer.text: Murray GD, Butcher I, Mchugh GS, et al. Multivariable prognostic analysis in traumatic brain injury: results from the IMPACT study. J Neurotrauma. 2007;24(2):329-37.

data.evidence:
Probability of 6-month mortality or unfavorable outcome = 1 / (1 + e-x), where x is as follows:


Model 

6-month outcome

Mortality

Unfavorable outcome*

Core

x = -3.109 + addition of the selected points**

x = -2.644 + addition of the selected points

Extended

x = -3.787 + addition of the selected points

x = -3.023 + addition of the selected points

Lab

x = -3.184 + addition of the selected points

x = -2.470 + addition of the selected points

*Unfavorable outcome = death, persistent vegetative state, or severe disability.

**Points for each variable in the core, extended, and lab models are provided below.

*Marshall CT classification:

Classification

Definition

Diffuse injury I

No visible intracranial pathology

Diffuse injury II

Cisterns present, midline shift ≤5 mm and/or lesion densities, no high/mixed density lesion >25 cm³

Diffuse injury III

Cisterns compressed or absent, midline shift ≤5 mm, no high/mixed density lesion >25 cm³

Diffuse injury IV

Midline shift >5 mm, no high/mixed density lesion >25 cm³

V

Any surgically-evacuated lesion

VI

High/mixed density lesion >25 cm³, not surgically evacuated

inputs.name: model
inputs.tips_en: Each subsequent model builds on the previous to add additional clinical data when available

inputs.name: motor
inputs.tips_en: If on sedation/paralysis or unable to be assessed, mark as "Not testable (NT)"

inputs.name: ct

options.label: Diffuse injury III or IV (swelling or shift)
V or VI (evacuated or non-evacuated mass lesion)

inputs.tips_en: See Evidence for detailed description of CT classes

inputs.name: hypoxia
inputs.tips_en: If hypoxia suspected but not confirmed, select "Yes"

inputs.name: hypotension
inputs.tips_en: If hypotension suspected but not confirmed, select "Yes"
